data.title: What is the reason for using &*beg instead of beg when beg is an iterator?
data.meta_description:
In the book "A Tour of C++" (third edition for C++20) from Bjarne Stroustrup, section 18.5.2 packaged task, we have this piece of code :
// compute the sum of [beg:end) starting with the
data.text:
In the book "A Tour of C++" (third edition for C++20) from Bjarne Stroustrup, section 18.5.2 packaged task, we have this piece of code :

// compute the sum of [beg:end) starting with the initial value init double accum(vector<double>::iterator beg, vector<double>::iterator end, double init) { return accumulate(&*beg, &*end, init); }
